result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Alberto Mendoza Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Mario Alberto Mendoza Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Mario Alberto Mendoza Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance.  (Brown Co. 21CM932)  Atty. Buckett states was unaware the defendant was in custody and request adjournment to further discuss the case.  Defendant requests video appearance for the next hearing as likely serving a 90 day sentence in Brown Co. Jail and court approves.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Mario Alberto Mendoza Rodriguez appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives right to appear in person.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  Court appoints Atty Robert Buckett.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11-15-2022.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $2,500.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
